(['Static Typing with Python'], ['See also', 'The documentation at ', ' is relatively accessible
and complete. Particularly refer to the “Type System Reference” section of
the docs – since the Python typing system is standardised via PEPs, this
information should apply to most Python type checkers.', ', the reference implementation for type
checkers.', ', written in OCaml and optimized for
performance.', ', a type checker that
emphasizes speed.', ', checks and infers types for
unannotated code.', ', an IDE that supports
type stubs both for type checking and code completion.', ', a code editor that
supports type checking using mypy, pyright, or the
', '
extension.', ', a code formatter with support for
type stub files.', ', a plugin for the
', ' linter that adds support for type
stubs.', ', a tool which infers simple types from their context and inserts them as inline type-hints.', ', integrates .pyi signatures as inline type-hints in Python source code.
This is a thin wrapper around ', ' from ', '.', ', literature overview on type hints', ', background on type hints', ', type hints', ', variable annotations and ', ', ', ', distributing typed packages', ', ', ', subscriptable generics in the standard library', ', ', ', ', ', ', ', ', ', union syntax with ', ', ', ', ', ', variadic generics and ', ', ', ' (draft), ', ', ', ' and ', ', ', ', ', ' (rejected), ', ' callable type syntax', ' ', ' ', ' ', ' for ', ' (draft), ', ' type parameter syntax', ' (draft), defaults for type variables', ' ', ' (draft), ', '
